div.p: RIOM an arrondissement of the department of Puy de Dome, in France, extending over 893 square miles. It comprehends thirteen cantons, divided into 130 communes, and in 1336 contained 151,456 inhabitants. The capital is the city of the same name, situated on the river Limagne. It is well buih, with broad streets, and is surrounded by five
promenades. It is the seat of a bishop, and had, in 1836,

11,473 inhabitants, who make linen cloth, cotton goods, serges, and cassimeres, glass, brandy, and leather ; and trade in wine, brandy, nut-oil, and flax-seed, by the river. Long. 3. 1. 45. E. Lat. 45. 54. 30. N.
